item.title: C++ - Boost Graph Library
item.description: Graphs are one of the fundamental and most used data structures. It’s everywhere. However, there is no standard implementation of C++ STL. You need to implement it in your way or using 3rd party library like Boost. In this blog post, I use the Boost Graph library and try to show you how easy it is with example codes. I hope you’ll find it useful. Constructing a Graph The adjacency_list is a template class with six template parameters.

item.title: How to integrate Catch2 ?
item.description: You can directly download the single header file(v2.13.3) using this link. https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2/releases/download/v2.13.3/catch.hpp If you want to discover the source code please checkout the library with the v2.x branch and copy the catch.hpp file on your source folder. git clone -b v2.x https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2.git ls -all Catch2/single_include/catch2/catch.hpp Here is my test folder. Please find the source code below. . ├── build ├── CMakeLists.txt ├── inc │ └── catch.hpp └── src └── main.cpp 3 directories, 2 files CMakeLists.

item.title: How to fix Docker Permission Issue
item.description: Got permission denied while trying to connect to the Docker daemon socket docker images Got permission denied while trying to connect to the Docker daemon socket at unix:///var/run/docker.sock: Get http://%2Fvar%2Frun%2Fdocker.sock/v1.40/images/json: dial unix /var/run/docker.sock: connect: permission denied TL;DR: Just run below commands from command prompt and skip the rest. sudo groupadd docker sudo usermod -aG sudo ${USER} sudo usermod -aG docker ${USER} su -s ${USER} docker run hello-world You need to do the following:

item.title: LF Mentorship Session
item.description: Notes from LF Live Mentorship Session: Best Practices to Getting Your Patches Accepted Important notes and links: Start watching mailing lists of your interest, https://lore.kernel.org/lists.html Take LFD103 which is a free LF training that offers tips on how to start contributing. Check this site to see if you can fix any bugs https://syzkaller.appspot.com/upstream https://training.linuxfoundation.org/training/a-beginners-guide-to-linux-kernel-development-lfd103/ https://kernelnewbies.org/ is a good start also check the #kernenewbies channel on OFTC

item.title: Take Pretty Screenshot
item.description: As you may imagine after complete a project you need to create a pretty, clear, and glaring README file. I believe it’s a de facto standard for open-source projects anymore. If you want to create an imposing markdown, you should use visual materials and efficient tongue for your audience. Here is one of my favorite tool for creating awesome README and editing screen shots. The App is Shutter Unfortunately this app does not exist in the official Manjaro Repos.

item.title: Free Learning Resources
item.description: Many publishers are temporarily providing free access to eBooks/slides/videos and other eContent during the COVID-19 crisis. I’ve arranged some of them I like. Please find below. Security, Pentesing, InfoSec - Web Link Exploit Development - Web Link Total OSCP Guide - Web Link Creating a Rootkit to Learn C - Web Link The TCP/IP Guide - Web Link Advanced SQL and database books and resources - Web Link Syncfusion - software development, data visualization, and data science - Web Link Mastering Embedded Linux - Blog Series - Web Link Course materials for Modern Binary Exploitation by RPISEC - Web Link OSCP Human Guide - Web Link Learn Regex by Examples - Web Link Mastering GNU Awk - Web Link Javascript Info - Web Link Malware Analysis course at University of Cincinnati, Jan 2020-Apr 2020 - Web Link Teach Yourself Computer Science - Web Link Deep Dive Into Modern Web Development - Web Link Malware Analysis Traning - Web Link Hundreds of freely accessible courses from METU - Web Link Computer Engineering - Web Link C Homework Collection - Very Best - Web Link Data Structure - Very Best - Web Link Awesome Reverse Engineering - Web Link Algorithm 101 from MIT - Web Link - Exams and Solutions C/C++ Books - Web Link Applications getdroid - Android Payload Listener - Web Link

item.title: More Productivity With Taskwarrior
item.description: Introduction to Taskwarrior I’ve actually been trying to use taskwarrior for my primary task managemnt tool about it for months without any progress. But today is the day. I am aware of the taskwarrior power when you configure optimal way for your requirements. I don’t explain why you have to choose taskwarrior in this post. If you are wondering how it is awesome, you can visit the official site for great explanation.

item.title: Getting Started With Jekyll
item.description: Quick-Start Commands gem install bundler gem install jekyll # need to installed ruby2.3-dev package # If the existing directory isn’t empty, you can pass the --force option with jekyll new . --force. jekyll new my-awesome-site cd my-awesome-site bundle exec jekyll serve # => Now browse to http://localhost:4000 # in project folder bundle info <gem> bundle update <gem> bundle exec jekyll serve # browse to localhost:4000 # another way to system wide upgrade to latest Rubygems, run: gem update --system Install gem dependencies in jekyll project;
